alert.note: Alert for Leon; Limestone; Navarro; Robertson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 6:46PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Freestone, northeastern Robertson, Leon, Limestone, southern Anderson and southeastern Navarro Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 643 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms. The strongest storms were located 12 miles southwest of Palestine, near Richland-Chambers Reservoir, and 8 miles south of Groesbeck. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palestine, Mexia, Groesbeck, Teague, Fairfield, Buffalo, Elkhart, Wortham, Centerville, Fairfield Lake, Lake Mexia, Twin Oak Reservoir, Richland-Chambers Reservoir, Fort Parker State Park, Fort Boggy State Park, Fairfield Lake State Park, Camp Creek Lake, Lake Limestone, Corinth, and Jewett. This includes Interstate 45 between mile markers 152 and 217. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
